description: Concatenate the natural numbers, then partition into minimal strings so that each term divides the next.
comments: What is the next term? (See A263623.)
references: Letter from the editor, J. Rec. Math., 3 (1970), 40-41.
N. J. A. Sloane, A Handbook of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1973 (includes this sequence).
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: Editor, J. Recreational Math., Letter, J. Rec. Math., 3 (1970), 40-41. [Annotated scanned copy]
prog: (Haskell)a002782 n = a002782_list !! (n-1)a002782_list = f 1 1 (map toInteger $ tail a007376_list) where   f x y (d:ds) | mod y x == 0 = y : f y d ds                | otherwise    = f x (10*y + d) ds-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 17 2011
crossrefs: See A007908 for a classic sequence of the same ilk.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
